item.title: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

To whom do you award the right to decide what is and what isn’t porn?
Dictionary definitions usually say something like “material designed to sexually arouse” but this is far too broad to use as a basis for a filter.

To me this is the largest problem with the .xxx and any sort of filter.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Then you get into the murky area of what is porn and what isn’t, which also can vary by jurisdiction. I really don’t think IANA wants to, or should become The Internet Porn Police.

Read full topic
item.source: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children

item.title: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:374010”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=469993.msg3436675#msg3436675 date=1292799783]
I think a .xxx domain would be brilliant because then it’s win-win for everyone. Introduce the domain, have a 3 month grace period where everyone who owns a .com or similar domain has the chance to register a new .xxx domain and inform their userbase of the changes, and then issue very very high fines to anyone who doesn’t comply.
[/quote]

Here’s why that fails: you’d need to make a law stating this in every single country that has internet access. Since you can’t do that, only the sites based in countries where that law is instated would be forced to move over, and those in other countries would have a leg up on the rest. That’s why the porn providers don’t want that to happen. :P[/quote]

What if it was an IANA rule (or whoever administrates that particular domain)? That would force it to happen regardless of country.

Read full topic
item.source: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children

item.title: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children

item.description:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:374010”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=469993.msg3436675#msg3436675 date=1292799783]
I think a .xxx domain would be brilliant because then it’s win-win for everyone. Introduce the domain, have a 3 month grace period where everyone who owns a .com or similar domain has the chance to register a new .xxx domain and inform their userbase of the changes, and then issue very very high fines to anyone who doesn’t comply.
[/quote]

Here’s why that fails: you’d need to make a law stating this in every single country that has internet access. Since you can’t do that, only the sites based in countries where that law is instated would be forced to move over, and those in other countries would have a leg up on the rest. That’s why the porn providers don’t want that to happen. :P[/quote]
Yeah, fair point. Good catch, didn’t even consider that at the time of posting the above.

Read full topic

@Mopman wrote:

Lothy:

I think a .xxx domain would be brilliant because then it’s win-win for everyone. Introduce the domain, have a 3 month grace period where everyone who owns a .com or similar domain has the chance to register a new .xxx domain and inform their userbase of the changes, and then issue very very high fines to anyone who doesn’t comply.

Here’s why that fails: you’d need to make a law stating this in every single country that has internet access. Since you can’t do that, only the sites based in countries where that law is instated would be forced to move over, and those in other countries would have a leg up on the rest. That’s why the porn providers don’t want that to happen.

item.title: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The problem, at least from where I’m standing, is that opt-in services like this wouldn’t be used by the majority of people. In Australia this is because we’re all apathetic.

Read full topic
item.source: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children

item.title: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I do think that for home users though, it should be an opt-in service, not one that is pushed on all users for them to then go and opt-out.

It could be then just seen as another layer of parental controls.

Read full topic
item.source: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children

item.title: All internet porn will be blocked to protect children
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It’s not really a big deal at this stage because, while initially thrust upon people, they have the ability to opt out of it.
This difference is key when comparing it to the Australian version, which was an all-encompassing mandatory filter; we weren’t going to have the ability to opt out.

I think a .xxx domain would be brilliant because then it’s win-win for everyone. Introduce the domain, have a 3 month grace period where everyone who owns a .com or similar domain has the chance to register a new .xxx domain and inform their userbase of the changes, and then issue very very high fines to anyone who doesn’t comply.
Blocking of porn in schools/libraries/homes with children becomes easy, and adults can still gain access to it at a whim if they wish to do so.

Read full topic
